result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for both Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 157 days were granted.
Concurrent with: With any current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Walmart Asset Recovery to be paid joint and several as a conditon of probation.

No Contact with co-defendants or Walmart stores. Continue with AODA treatment. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ashley M Lewis in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years)CONCURRENT with any current sentence. Credit for 157 days.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Restitution in the amount of $2,267.00 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) to Walmart Asset Recovery as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with codefendants or Walmart stores.  Continue with AODA treatment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant appeared by video
